page.title: 02WHERE WE LIVE
page.content: The area we surveyed is rural with many farms and the occasional cluster of houses forming a hamlet or village.It is a beautiful area with rounded hills giving vantage points for viewing the glories of the Derby- shire scenery. Most of the fields of mainly mowing grass,cereals or grazing land are bounded by stone walls but towards the eastern side hedges begin to appear.There are few major roads and no railway.Most of the lanes are well metalled but extremely winding and peaceful giving he passenger or pedestrian the view of banks of wild flowers and an abundance of wildlife at every turn.There are a number of stone quarries and mines in the area but most of them are abandoned and are merging back into the country- side-no longer a blot on the {lanscape.
